text:
Is it possible to use Apache Arrow to create a DataFrame that is larger than the available system memory?
I don’t really need this ATM, but for peace of mind, I would like the capability to create a DataFrame of, say, 200 GB on my MacBook Pro that has 16 GB memory.

text: Is there a good web scraping package in Julia?

elements.text: Is there a good web scraping package in Julia?

text:
I did some scraping for another hobby project in R earlier this year. This downloads Titanic passenger data from the wikipedia page. (Not sure if it still works.)
```read_as_tibble <- function(n) {
  xpath <-str_c(c('//*[@id="mw-content-text"]/div[1]/table[', n, ']'), 
                collapse = '')
  
  t <- read_html('<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Passengers_of_the_RMS_Titanic>') %>% 
    rvest::html_nodes('body') %>% 
    xml2::xml_find_all(xpath) %>%
    html_table(fill = T)
  t <- t[[1]]
  
  tibble(Name = t$Name,
         Age = t$Age,
         Hometown = t$Hometown,
         Destination = t$Destination) %>%
    add_column(DataSource = 'wiki')
}```

elements.text: I did some scraping for another hobby project in R earlier this year. This downloads Titanic passenger data from the wikipedia page. (Not sure if it still works.)

read_as_tibble <- function(n) {
  xpath <-str_c(c('//*[@id="mw-content-text"]/div[1]/table[', n, ']'), 
                collapse = '')
  
  t <- read_html('

') %>% 
    rvest::html_nodes('body') %>% 
    xml2::xml_find_all(xpath) %>%
    html_table(fill = T)
  t <- t[[1]]
  
  tibble(Name = t$Name,
         Age = t$Age,
         Hometown = t$Hometown,
         Destination = t$Destination) %>%
    add_column(DataSource = 'wiki')
}

text:
Ah! The arrow package in R has in its documents code that downloads NYC taxi data in parquet format, so I’ll just use that.
<https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/arrow/vignettes/dataset.html>

elements.text: Ah! The arrow package in R has in its documents code that downloads NYC taxi data in parquet format, so I’ll just use that.

text: R has surprising packages. The Finnish health authorities have data download in an obscure format I never heard about, tried Python for it I think, and then just used an R package that worked straight away, let me see…

elements.text: R has surprising packages. The Finnish health authorities have data download in an obscure format I never heard about, tried Python for it I think, and then just used an R package that worked straight away, let me see…

text: That was in JSON-stat, and downloading with rjstat worked straight away. My thoughts with Python were just WTF…

elements.text: That was in JSON-stat, and downloading with rjstat worked straight away. My thoughts with Python were just WTF…

text: :open_mouth:

I downloaded 28 GB of Parquet files with R, read them with R’s Arrow, wrote one single feather files that’s 105 GB. Then opened that feather file with Julia.
```using DataFrames, Arrow
df = DataFrame(Arrow.Table("nyc-taxi/feather/part-0.feather"))
1,231,773,935 rows × 20 columns (omitted printing of 15 columns)```

elements.text: I downloaded 28 GB of Parquet files with R, read them with R’s Arrow, wrote one single feather files that’s 105 GB. Then opened that feather file with Julia.

using DataFrames, Arrow
df = DataFrame(Arrow.Table("nyc-taxi/feather/part-0.feather"))
1,231,773,935 rows × 20 columns (omitted printing of 15 columns)

text:
I think it is actually working. It’s a bit hard to tell as I don’t know the correct answers.
```describe(df, :min, :max, :mean, cols=:passenger_count)
1 rows × 4 columns

variable	min	max	mean
Symbol	Int8	Int8	Float64
1	passenger_count	-127	97	1.66498```

text:
R complained this when I tried the same:
```Error: summarize() is not currently implemented for Arrow Datasets. Call collect() first to pull data into R.```
